website_summaries.verdict: Great value for a family-sized tent that offers significant water resistance.
pros: Holds a handful of adults and several children

customer_reviews.title: Poles snapping on the first time out are not a great experience I want to repeat
customer_reviews.text: During the course of my week long camping trip in Texas, The pole supporting the front awning as well as the pole support for left side (not the main pole, the one that goes front to back to hold the screen up) snapped due to the heat. We were forced to crowd to one end since the other wasn't usable. Poles snapping on the first time out are not a great experience I want to repeat. The instruction book shows replacement parts listings. I think I'll order the poles and just give it to my nephew and buy a travel trailer...
customer_reviews.author: ricky crabtree

customer_reviews.title: Great tent with some setbacks
customer_reviews.text: I love this tent. My family has used it a ton. It’s easy to assemble and has a lot of room in it. It withstands weather really well. Recently the zipper broke for the door and some poles are breaking. I expected it to last a lot longer. It’s unfortunate because I was hoping to get a few more years out of it. We’ve made due with the issues since we love it. But we’ll have to buy a new one before we know it.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: Rainfly poles
customer_reviews.text: Like many people here my rainfly poles broke after 2 uses. This is a quick fix that worked for me. The poles are about 1 inch too long. I fixed the broken poles by punching the broken tip out of the metal sleeve with a small screwdriver. Then you can break these small 1 inch sections of fiberglass off of the elastic string with a hammer or I used a flat wire cutter to split mine off. Worked great after that. Now they are the proper length. Another tip is don't stake the corners tight, causing them to tear out. Other than that this is a great roomy, easy to assemble tent.
customer_reviews.author: Connie Hein

customer_reviews.title: has issues, poles too long(so they break)
customer_reviews.text: front rain fly pole broke first time I put up. called for replacement, after 1/2 an hour sounded like it was taken care of (even did their review) but a week and half later-no replacement! called again and had to start all over again, ( and they wanted me to give them a review again) now past the time to return. jumped through all there hoops but had to use with a broken pole. was very unhappy with the process, tent itself is nice. second time I put this tent up second rainfly pole broke in same spot. I read another review, about taking the broken end piece and eliminating it, making the pole an inch shorter, this worked well.
customer_reviews.author: RICK

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent for large family!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this tent for our 4th of July camping trip. It slept myself, my spouse and 3 kids comfortably. We had a queen mattress and full sized mattress with room to spare! It was extremely easy to assemble. The only thing I didn’t like is that it’s not truly waterproof. It rained for a few hours during our trip and the corners of the tent all leaked. I purchased the Coleman seam sealer, but found it difficult to use and time consuming. I would recommend a waterproof spray. Waterproof BEFORE using. Other then that it was perfect!
customer_reviews.author: MotherHustler247

customer_reviews.title: Multiple broken parts after 1 use
customer_reviews.text: It is spacious and fairly easy to assemble. But in my experience, the first day I used it the rep collapsible poles that go with the rainfly broke in the joints. Today I was cleaning it up and noticed that the strap that attaches the tent body to one of the anchor metal rings broke. That makes the tent unusable because I won’t be able to stretch that corner. To that same anchor ring attaches the main tent poles. I’m impressed by the low quality of the materials. I don’t know if mine is an outlier but it’s hard to believe so many defective parts breaking down after two nights of use.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian V

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: This tent was easy to set up. It needed at least two people to put the poles up. My husband did add waterproofing to the seams. It rained while we were camping. We had no leaks. I highly recommend! Great tent for the price and size.
customer_reviews.author: K. Carew

customer_reviews.title: NOT for tall people!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this tent because it states that it is 72" in the middle. IT IS NOT. It is only about 68-69" AT MOST. Worst of all, it let the dew in through the walls. Anything that was touching the tent itself got soaked! For our camping trip I bought two Coleman items: a stove and a tent. BOTH were of poor quality. What the heck happened Coleman? You used to make quality items and had a good reputation. Not anymore it seems.
customer_reviews.author: DCW

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATER PROOF
customer_reviews.text: Ok I bought this tent in 2017 I've ised it 3 times and have taken good care of it. This last time it lightly rained and came right through dripping all over our air mattress and floor. We of course has the "rain guard" on and ya...not fun. If you're going to be camping in dry areas then this is great roomy tent but I live in the Pacific Northwest wear it could be sunny one day raining in the next so I wouldn't recommend it if you're in that type of climate
customer_reviews.author: Katrina

customer_reviews.title: Useless without heavy duty stakes and waterproofing spray
customer_reviews.text: Our first night was at the Grand Canyon. The tent leaked through the rainfly. Our fourth night was in Death Valley. The tent was blowing away and collapsing on itself with 20 mph wind. This tent was supposed to be waterproof. This tent was supposed to stand up in 35 mph wind. Luckily we purchased heavy duty tent stakes and kiwi waterproofing spray along the way. With those two additions the tent worked great and held up to weather. DO NOT buy this tent and expect it to be weatherproof out of the box, BUT with some heavy duty stakes and waterproof spray this tent will do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Good tent but this thing takes up a lot of ...
customer_reviews.text: Good tent but this thing takes up a lot of real estate! In addition to the 17' x 10' footprint the tie down cords go out an extra 5-6 feet on the sides and another 3-4 feet in front and back. This means for a 27' x 16' area you will have either tent or cords to deal with. Again, good tent, but the design requires a lot of space.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Love
customer_reviews.text: It’s Huge! I wanted a bigger tent, and this is like a hotel- lol. My favorite thing about this tent—- if u don’t put on the rain fly , almost the entire roof is screened, allowing you to lay down and fully view stars. Size wise- this easily fit two queen air mattresses with plenty of additional room room to spare . I also like that u can add a “wall” by hanging a divider. We had great weather so I can’t speak to weatherproof- but hoping it holds up like past Coleman’s we’ve had.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Practice tent set ups and take downs prior to camping trip.
customer_reviews.text: Positive-Red Canyon tent is a good size for us with queen size mattress and our 90 lb Golden Doodle. Plenty of head room. Love the door entrance/exit zipper easy to use and does not snag. With practice set up takes 15 mins. Negative - poor instructions out of the box. I'm an experienced camper of 20+ years and various tents. Even with multiple practice set up and take downs......finally developed my own process to setup. Awning pole did not make it thru a weekend camping trip. Fiberglass broke. There are two awning poles for front and rear....so no big deal. IMO poor quality or MFG issue, but these poles should last years. Working on replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Stuart

customer_reviews.title: Good for 4/6 people
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tent but really fits four to six people. If I had to do it again I would get a ten person tent. We have two cots for the adults and two kids on the floor and the tent is full. The "room dividers" are pretty practical. Has practical pockets through the interior too. Great value. Quality product. UPDATE: it did leak a tiny bit at the bottom seams but it was a severe 12 hour storm. I'll seal the seams at the bottom. Still would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: knows-it-all

customer_reviews.title: Spacious with some downsides
customer_reviews.text: This tent was amazingly large and roomy. It had enough room for our queen air mattress plus a mini crib. We used one of the wall dividers to create a space for our toddler and we had plenty of space to spare. It was fairly difficult and time consuming to put up and then it never fit back in the carrying case that came with it which is a big deal breaker for me. We did not have any weather on the trip so can't speak to the weatherproofing or water resistance. Good for car camping but you will need some time and a different carrying case.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Trusted name and trusted product.
customer_reviews.text: Used for many outings. survived the rain, some light snow, hot Arizona sun and the dry New Mexico heat. Bonus is that it fits 2 queen size mattresses and 3 twins comfortably. Cleans up very nice after rain and dust storms. VERY easy to set up with one person and even easier with 2 people, average time of 10 minutes once you have set up once. I highly recommend this product to anyone anywhere. I am still using this tent to date 11/28/16!! I did not receive this item at a discounted price and this is a true review. if you find my review helpful please let me know by clicking below.
customer_reviews.author: Jerizona

customer_reviews.title: Wish I would have tested this sooner 😕
customer_reviews.text: Set it up proper, we're not novices at tent set up, first rain and a bit of wind and the front post for the rain flap broke and our tent took on water.. u can only stand up in 1 small section of the tent to change and what not. Not very well with air flow either.
customer_reviews.author: xbmwx

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent
customer_reviews.text: This is the second time we are buying this tent for our family of five. We had our first one for 8 years and the zipper finally gave out after three boys tugging on it along with several scouts during scout trips. My boys can put this tent up by themselves within 10 minutes. The only complaint I have is the storage bag could be a little larger and needed to be repaired a couple times over the years.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this tent ONE time and two of the stake tabs broke off. Such a big waste of money!! We really loved the tent when we set it up and during our 5 day camping trip, but were thoroughly disappointed in the quality now that its unusable after just one trip. I read through the other reviews here and it definitely looks like we aren't the only one with this issue. I recommend buying a tent with a warranty or from a different retailer that offers an extended warranty.
customer_reviews.author: N. Sawyer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed in shape & lack of window closings
customer_reviews.text: We just set this tent up in preparation for our camping trip this weekend. I was disappointed that it is not a true 10' x 17' rectangle. I should have realized from the photo, but it wasn't clear that the ends angle in. This will make it cramped for us as we normally put air mattresses in. I was also disappointed that the end windows don't have zipper closings (which leaves them open to breezes and it's cold where we camp) and the door zipper is hard to operate. I would not have bought this tent if I'd known these things. Otherwise, it looks like it'll hold up.
customer_reviews.author: C. Hall

customer_reviews.title: good tent.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the floor comes about 3" up off the ground so the seam between the floor and the walls does not have standing water or morning dew on the grass against it. We use this as a two person tent so we can bring all of our camping and fishing gear inside to keep in dry when it rains. Very roomy inside. I can put a queen air mattress in one end and other gear in the other end and still stand straight up to get dressed in the morning, I am 5'8".
customer_reviews.author: 186xt

customer_reviews.title: Don't Waste Your Money!!
customer_reviews.text: I used this tent for the first time this last weekend. On our last day of camping we had rain, and this tent leaked like a sieve around any of the seams. We ended up with large puddles of water inside the tent after just a few hours of rain. It's hard for me to believe this is a Coleman product. I would not recommend this tent to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is huge. We fit two queen size air mattresses and had plenty room for maybe two more twin mattresses. We set it up at night while it was raining. The directions got a little confusing, but we figured it out and had it up in no time. We do have some parts to the tent we have no idea what they go to and the directions don't have them listed on them. Some of the parts to hold down the tent are plastic and did break on us, which was disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: HUGE
customer_reviews.text: It is GIANT. Giant. Let me repeat, GIANT. Can fit 3 queen mattresses, maybe more! Easy to put up - was done with 2 people in 10mins. Could probably be done solo would just be a little ungainly. Very nice, Coleman is great quality!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Huge!
customer_reviews.text: We were told to go up on the number of people, this one is huge for us 4 but we love the extra space, we've tried it on controlled space, not yet outside on a camping trip but I can say it is well built. It was somewhat easy to set up with help from my wife. The seams look good. So far happy with the purchase
customer_reviews.author: FranciscoV

customer_reviews.title: Large Tent/Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: Huge Tent! Husband and I fit a queen air mattress and 2 large dogs with quite a bit of extra room. Good quality as usual from Coleman, very easy setup with two people. First trip it was used there was down pouring rain and wind...tent was dry as a bone and no damage. Only side notes would be that I don’t prefer how the sheet for separating the space connects to the actual tent and it could use another storage pocket or two.
customer_reviews.author: NSquared

customer_reviews.title: Nice family tent.
customer_reviews.text: This goes up fairly easily and is plenty roomy. It also packs away nicely. I have not tried it in heavy rain yet, so I do not know how it will stand up to that. The one criticism is that it takes some extra effort to get the floor to lie flat. Also the dividers seem useless to me, but that is just personal preference.
customer_reviews.author: Puffdoggy

customer_reviews.title: Snapped Pole.
customer_reviews.text: Well as the title says. I wanted to love this tent but it says weather tec right on it and the pole snapped the first real storm i was in which soaked all my stuff and obviously left the tent useless. Believe me when i say I'm meticulous in setting up so it wasn't a operator error. Like i said i really wanted to love it but i left me hanging.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Alford

customer_reviews.title: It's a good tent and I like it over all
customer_reviews.text: It's a good tent and I like it over all, but it needs some improvement. I don't like how it doesn't have a mud Flap for shoes. It does not have a hole for an extension cord, so you need to put it through the door ( I needed to change my phone) It's impossible to get back in the bag right! My Husband and I have been putting away tents our whole lives it's not like we are new to it The zipper always gets caught The zipper string broke when it got caught 😡
customer_reviews.author: Candace Bruzda

customer_reviews.title: Also a great tent we purchased this Coleman tent for the family ...
customer_reviews.text: Also a great tent we purchased this Coleman tent for the family accompanying us on our yearly camping trip we own the Coleman canyon breeze another great Coleman tent but it was no longer available. I was initially worried because I knew that my tent had held up to some serious abuse. But this Coleman tent did not disappoint either...we had a severe downpours and neither tents leaked a drop of water...it was well constructed and we had no breaks or tears in any of the material. These big tents are so worth the extra set up time....they are simply more comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: shamian callender

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent !!
customer_reviews.text: passed with flying colors ...we had a SEVERE thunderstorm while this was set up and inside was dry as could be. The setup took me a little longer than it will the next time as it was my first time putting up a tent but it sets up quickly and easily... may have taken me 30 minutes the first time ? Take down also was a breeze. Yes I can recommend this tent ...I'm 6' 1" and while no I can't stand up straight it's far better than a pup tent plenty of room for my purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent tent
customer_reviews.text: Received this last week, after a text message to Amazon asking why it had been "waiting to ship" for 11 days. They responded by sending it FedEx the next day. Tent went up super easy - fit me and 7 kids comfortably. Disappointed, though, that one of the poles for the rain cover snapped the following night. Tent is still usable, but am hoping that pole is not indicative of more pole problems to come. Hoping Coleman helps put with replacement poles.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.text: I have owned one of the Coleman Canyon tents for 6 years now, and have not had any issues with it leaking, ripping or splitting at seams at all. The only thing that is "wrong" with it, is the fabric that guides the poles, is wearing out after 6 summers of use. Not something that I am going to worry about as this will be delegated as a backup tent probably before the end of the season. I have bought 2 others of this same tent as gifts and both of the recipients have had similar experiences to me. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: williamsr81

customer_reviews.title: Quality tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent has held up for a few years now and multiple trips. It is relatively easy to setup - generally requires two people to put up. It has tons of room where we can fit 4 twin air mattresses and still have room for our gear and other items. Pretty good height clearance as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Cob

customer_reviews.title: Tons of room.
customer_reviews.text: Kept us safe from rain and is huge inside. My husband is 5"11 and stands up in it. Very pleased and will use a lot with our big family. We had an air mattress, pack n play and two large sleeping bags zipped together for the kids. We have 4 young kids, it was fun and plenty of room! I will say the zipper did stick a lot! And the pegs for the ground sucked!
customer_reviews.author: David and Kay-Marie Stanger

customer_reviews.title: rather easy but will take 2 people or 1 more clever ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought it and set it up, rather easy but will take 2 people or 1 more clever than me for the raising of the tent. Startup and finishing touches can be done by one. I had it up for a week in Wisconsin summer, 2 rains. Tent was just fine throughout, but with open ventilation on both sides that cannot be closed I would not use this in colder periods. Takedown can be done by one person.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Bonlender

customer_reviews.title: Huge Tent
customer_reviews.text: Tent is huge!! So much room inside this tent. We wet up two queen size air mattresses on each side of the tent, there was plenty of room at the head and foot of the mattresses for storage. In the middle of the tent there was plenty of room to move about and change clothing, etc. It is a little challenging to set-up, easier if you have more than 2 people setting this up. We experienced a heavy storm during our recent camping trip and no problems with this tent, no leaks anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: They don’t make them like they used to
customer_reviews.text: We love the size and the set up is easy but the tension is so tight on the fly that both the front and back poles snapped. We are huge Coleman fans and chose this tent over another because it was Coleman (our last tent lasted 6 years) While we did stay dry in a midnight storm that rolled through with heavy rain the poles were a disappointment. Also while pulling the stakes the yellow stake holder tab pulled off the tent. Making it pretty useless from here on out. We only got 6 useable nights out of this one. I guess they don’t make them like they used to.
customer_reviews.author: R Aiels

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS right through rainfly
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste money. As other reviews say not waterproof. First trip it rained overnight, not hard just typical overnight passing shower. Tent leaked right through rain fly down onto beds. Also, little leaks around seams of floor where tension from poles and stakes. Size was great, headroom was good, set up was not that hard with 1 person. Good ventilation, may be little cold on cool nights with all vents. BUT it leaks right through rainfly, why bother buying unless plan on hanging tarp over tent each camping trip.
customer_reviews.author: Iain McGregor

customer_reviews.title: So Far, So Good
customer_reviews.text: Have used three times: Easy to set up. Easy to take down. No holes, rips, etc., during use. Sleeps 5 comfortably, with room for more. Cool during the summer in the mountains; warm during the winter in the desert. Dividers = great. Should my experience change, you'll be the first to hear about it (that is, if you're reading this review if and after my experience has changed). Peace.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-Jo '77

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality
customer_reviews.text: This tent has come in very handy for multiple camping trips. I have experienced some very cold and damp nights while camping in this tent, but the moisture never gets in. Lakeside or beachside, this tent has never let me down. Lots of room to move around. I call it my portable mansion.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality tent. The first time I took it out with me and my family it ended up raining the next morning. There were only minor drips coming in from seams, which isn't bad at all given the amount of rain and wind we received that day. The inside if very roomy and I was able to stand up all the way in the middle of the tent. I've camped with this a few times at this point and it's holding up well.
customer_reviews.author: C. Harrop

customer_reviews.title: What a trooper!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tent. We have camped in it about 6 times. It can fit 3 queen air mattresses in it. It stayed standing through 45mph gust and a several Nebraska nighttime thunderstorms(4+ hours of rain). No leaks! One thing that is so important: you MUST use the attached velcro fasteners on the rainfly to secure it to the outer tent rods. It will help the stability of the tent if the rainfly is teathered down tightly. A couple 60mph wind gusts forced down one outer rod of the tent(it popped right back out when the wind subsided)-We then moved our vehicle in front of the tent to help block the wind. Money well spent with this tent
customer_reviews.author: Rachel Moeser

customer_reviews.title: Not good for rainy conditions
customer_reviews.text: Decent, good size and easy to get up / down, rain flap doesn't cover enough to keep you dry during a hard / prolonged rain, we took it out and got rained on for a solid day and had water get in all four corners, comes through the walls. Not sure what the "WeatherTec" feature means because it obviously isn't for rain resistance.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Moses

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up even for one person to do it. Alot of room. I purchased this for just myself, set up a queen size air mattress and had plenty of room to spare. The only down fall that I seen is the tent pegs are weak so order heavier ones to go with it
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy. Mine was defective out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Brand new tent. Fresh out of the box. Take it out for the first time and it has a huge hole in the mesh door. The mesh is completely torn. We couldn’t keep the bugs out of the tent. This is literally the first time I’ve ever set this thing up and it looks like this (see photos.) and because I had to wait until our first camp trip to set it up, I missed my return window. So I spent $200 on a defective tent that I’m stuck with.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: The tent itself was great. Unfortunately the one we sent had been marked ...
customer_reviews.text: The tent itself was great. Unfortunately the one we sent had been marked "returned,opened but never used" which would have been fine, but it was most definitely used. The bottom was still wet and muddy and there was a dead butterfly inside when we set it up, with tears in the screens and side. It was very quick to set up (I could do it myself in about 20 minutes and it was the first tent I'd ever touched, my kids were pretty proud) but it's either easy to tear or the people who used it before were crazy.
customer_reviews.author: Tori

customer_reviews.title: Great tent
customer_reviews.text: Great tent easy to set up; the kids put it up while I got dinner ready! The first night camping there was a heavy rain, the old tent we have had a puddle in it and this New tent was completely dry!!! After the first night we all slept in the same tent. Two adults and three large teenagers fit comfortably.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa C.

customer_reviews.title: Really great tent I would say it sleeps more like 6 ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second time purchasing this tent the first one I purchased was about 10 years ago. Held up really well! Never have a problem with leaking during the rain and we’ve camped while it’s down pouring. Really great tent I would say it sleeps more like 6 rather then 8. We use air mattresses and it’s a little tight with 6 people.
customer_reviews.author: Aleece Pezo-Candelario

customer_reviews.title: Not the Coleman quality we are used to
customer_reviews.text: We have been really disappointed with this tent. We’ve been camping our entire lives and have been loyal to Coleman products. We have almost all Coleman camping gear! Our last Coleman tent lasted for 15 years. This weekend, we used this tent for the SECOND time, the SECOND night, and it’s less than a year old and we already have several tears in the seams. Although it has WEATHERTECH printed across the front, don’t let that fool you. One thunderstorm had our tent caved in and with 3 inches of water in it while we were out exploring. I expected a lot more from Coleman. They aren’t made like they used to be!!
customer_reviews.author: RYAN DAVIS

customer_reviews.title: This is a great family tent
customer_reviews.text: Update: after 5 camping trips the zipper for the door is broken. I can't attest to durability quite yet as we have only used it for one camping trip so far but after the first use I LOVE IT. It is easy to set up. My husband and I set it up in the dark with no problems. It's easy to stand up inside in the center and you don't have to crouch much to get through the door which saves my back. It's very spacious inside, good for a family.
customer_reviews.author: Daniella Twigg

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: This worked well, though the rain-fly could be a bit larger, it always lets in water as you unzip the door flap. It was easy to put in 4 people with ALL their gear at a weekend (2 night) campout in the rain and wind. Probably could have snuck in 1 or 2 more kids if we had to. Brought a small rag rug to capture mud/water from boots as you entered. Next time will easily hold 2 adult-sized folding cots.
customer_reviews.author: M. Ryder

customer_reviews.title: Okay for price definitely not a tent for the cold weather or wind
customer_reviews.text: Easy set up. Instructions were not so clear though. Bag to store in doesn't come with extender which makes it difficult to store it back inside the bag. I got color black. Sides were not zippered windows only mesh and fly although covered the side windows insane amount of draft came in. Thank goodness we had a heater, temperature was in the 50's.
customer_reviews.author: YS

customer_reviews.title: no directions for putting up tent
customer_reviews.text: The tent is a nice size and you can stand up in the middle. Easily has room for a queen and single bed plus your gear. But there's no directions for putting up the tent. There's a picture, but no where does it tell you that the poles are color-coded with the seams in the tent. Or in what order you should erect the poles. Also, you're led to believe there's a Velcro patch that allow access for the drop cord to run out of the tent. There's no such thing. And of course, the tent doesn't fit back in the bag.
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Crowell

customer_reviews.title: No recommend
customer_reviews.text: I dont recommend this tent. The first night in our camping was ruining. Raindrops fell inside the tent during the whole time it was raining. We couldn't sleep. Definitely bas quality.
customer_reviews.author: Paola

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: I like how easy it is to set up and take down. The longest part was rolling it up to put back in the bag. It does smell like it came right off the boat and it only has 2 windows you can open with the rain-fly on. It didn't rain on our camping trip so idk if it is weatherproof.
customer_reviews.author: Smiths

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy !!!
customer_reviews.text: This tent was terrible. It was very flimsy and definitely not waterproof. This tent is only good for perfect conditions. We had some wind and the tent first collapsed from the front and I was sleeping with the roof of the tent literally 2 feet from my face. The stakes didn’t stay in the ground, there’s no support in the front. Parts of me where cut where the tent had collapsed during some wind and rain. The tent let in puddles of water. It was a terrible experience in this thing and I was highly disappointed. Do not buy !
customer_reviews.author: Tyree B Davis

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane Proof!!!
customer_reviews.text: This tent is awesome! I went beach camping this past weekend and our group was hit by Hurricane Laura. We had three tents from three different companies; this one was the best at holding out the 20-30 mph winds and torrential rainfall. It is definitely waterproof. We ended up having enough space to move one of our collapsed tents belongings into ours and still had 4 adults comfortably sleep on a queen air mattress. This tent is spacious, strong, and sturdy. Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Sebastian Gawel

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent!
customer_reviews.text: This will be the third year I have used this tent for camping. Inside of this tent is spacious! It has 'partitions' that you can attach inside for division of 'rooms'. Description says 8-person tent, which would be true if each of the 8-persons are using sleeping bags; which we didn't. I would say, this would fit about 2 queen size air mattresses comfortably, and possibly one additional twin mattress. Can't provide full review about ease of setup, but I would think it shouldn't be that hard. During our first use, my husband, who has never put up a tent before then, was able to do it mostly by himself.
customer_reviews.author: sa2807

customer_reviews.title: Overall good quality. Cheap bamboo supports above window openings
customer_reviews.text: I put it together the weekend before I took my family camping. I wanted to make sure I could put it together easily, and I wanted to treat it for waterproof it. I had the tent all together and then heard a crackling noise. The source was the bamboo rod for one of the rain flies that goes above the window had split and snapped. It makes no sense why theses are made of cheap bamboo while the rest of the tent supports are made of heavier duty fiberglass. We went camping without the second bamboo support above the window opening. I would have given this tent 5 stars if not for that.
customer_reviews.author: Embreo1

customer_reviews.title: Love this tent but my husband will never stop saying ...
customer_reviews.text: Love this tent but my husband will never stop saying how big it is! It's like a camping mansion! Lol! We had our double air bed on one side, two single airbeds on the other for our 2 older kids, a pack and play in the middle area for our toddler and there was still tons of room to play lol! My husband wishes I got something smaller Bc it's but as cozy but we'll grow into it, we're a family if 5 and the kids are young and I'm sure we will have this forever as they grow up Nd have friends camping etc. it is big but it's easy to set up
customer_reviews.author: JJsMommy

customer_reviews.title: it's like a portable lodge.
customer_reviews.text: just used it this weekend. it is stupid big. seriously. that could be because there were only 2 adults and a preschooler in it, but it still felt like a gymnasium inside the thing. at 5'7" you can stand comfortably inside it. set up and take down were pretty easy, and the airflow is decent. zippers are so-so. folds down to a decent enough size for car camping and isn't terribly heavy. overall design is alright. for the price, it's an awesome tent if you want something a medieval ruler would have camped in on the battlefield. seriously, i need to invest in animal furs and some maps to have strewn about on our next "campaign".
customer_reviews.author: evan

customer_reviews.title: Holds up great in high winds!!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure how to rate this. You can tell by the pictures that the anchors started to tear. However, this is over 10 days straight. It rained - down poor for 3 days and no leaks. 1 day had 30-45 MPH gusts of wind- to the point I thought the tent would take off. Not sure if we can use it for a second camper by trip, but for the size and the length it’s a great price. I have to say that this tent took a beating pretty bad and still stood strong. So I’m going five stars!
customer_reviews.author: The Boss

customer_reviews.title: Defective tent poles!
customer_reviews.text: We ordered this tent a couple of months ago and used it for a camping trip to Moab, Utah. Upon setting up the tent and then putting on the rain fly, the poles for the front and back door fell apart/broke. When we asked to have them replaced, we were sent a new tent. This time, we took it with us to California, set things up without incident and then awoke in the morning to the same poles pretty much disintegrated. We attempted to "mend" them, to no avail. Wondering if this is an entire lot of defective tents or if we just won the broken pole lottery!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Tent, but it's discontinued.
customer_reviews.text: Like most other reviewers, I do like this tent. We've used it on numerous family and Scouting camping trips, and are completely satisfied with it. My one peeve is that the pole for the rain flap broke after several trips. Coleman has discontinued this tent, so finding a replacement for the pole isn't as easy as ordering a new one from Amazon. I would highly recommend Coleman tents, but suggest that you purchase a tent that has not yet been discontinued. Hopefully that would make finding replacement parts less problematic
customer_reviews.author: Beeker

customer_reviews.title: Poor zipper
customer_reviews.text: Our family moved this tent the first time or two we used it however, after the second use the zipper started to jam, get stuck or come of track. When spending nearly $200 on a tent the expectation is a little higher. The previous tent we had, we used in our family for nearly 30 years.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda McEwen

customer_reviews.title: Big Tent
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up and take down. relatively light weight. I do not see the point in the room dividers. just more things to fold up and try to fit back in the bag. the bag could be a little bigger but with some diligence it can all fit.
customer_reviews.author: David VanderSchuur

customer_reviews.title: Amazing water and wind proof tent!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for firefly music festival 2015 and it totally exceed my expectations. First, it was HUGE! Second, this year at firefly was extremely rainy and we encountered a massive lighting, wind, and rain storm and this tent held its own. Everyone around us had flooded tents, but not us! Not a drop of water! And it was so easy to put up. I had to set it up alone before the rest of my group arrived and it was a piece of cake. HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TENT TO EVERYONE! Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: rlembke2010

customer_reviews.title: Leaked and messing in the rain
customer_reviews.text: When we got this the weather for our camping trip turned sour for the first day. When we set up camp it was drizzling a little bit, and slow rained harder as the day/night went on. It comes with a little entry mat, which was nice, but still didn't allow for great cover. Would have been nicer if the rain cover jutted out further over the entrance. As we were enjoying our nights festivities we were unaware that our sleeping bags and pillows were slowly getting wetter and wetter inside the tent. I could understand maybe a little water, but this seemed excessive. All in all very disappointed in the quality of design and manufacturing of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin W. Craine

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't withstand a big storm
customer_reviews.text: One year we went to Assateague Island, it was awesome, some wind, no rain, held up great, it was perfect. Then we took it to the Outer Banks, and we had wind gusts up to 40 mph and it poured rain. 1. If there's a strong driving storm, rain will get in under the rainfly. 2. If you are going to the beach or an open area with strong wind gusts, consider heavy duty stakes. It's great if you have perfect weather. If a big storm comes out of nowhere, you're gonna be in trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for tough weather and short term use!
customer_reviews.text: Stood up to 45mph gusts and 25mph constant winds during recent storm. Only negative is the fly velcro is cheaply glued on amd quickly broke and needed tape. Amazing design, poor execution.
customer_reviews.author: Sensual Sojourn

customer_reviews.title: Setup isn't too bad although having help works great due to it's size
customer_reviews.text: Very roomy tent. Setup isn't too bad although having help works great due to it's size. We sprayed it down with water proofing as well just in case and didn't have any problems in the light/medium rain. We had a bigger storm and some water from outside came through the little vent flap in the back because it hit the ground and bounced up but just closing that during a storm would fix that problem. It held up fine to decent speed wind gusts as well.
customer_reviews.author: Wraith7n

customer_reviews.title: Weak Poles
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy after the first setup. However, when taking the tent down during our first camping trip with it (the second time it was set up), one of the poles broke. We contacted Coleman for a pole replacement kit. The replacement kit that Coleman sent us turned out to be the wrong size. Because we were on a time crunch and our local outdoors chain didn't have what we were looking for, we threw the tentin the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: The tent seems to be constructed well and is perfect as a summer/spring/fall tent
customer_reviews.text: This is definitely not a winter tent because it has mesh windows that cannot be closed. Beware of breezes that can make the tent very cold, and if you're using this in the winter, bring something to block the windows. The tent seems to be constructed well and is perfect as a summer/spring/fall tent.
customer_reviews.author: cgivler

customer_reviews.title: Great price for a mansion of a tent
customer_reviews.text: good price for a large tent. FIrst tent came with a broken rod and unfortunately I failed to properly inspect the materials prior to the trip so luckily for some bungy cord I had laying around I was able to Jerymand the tent up as properly as I could. Besides that the tent was spacious and cool in the hot summer night. Offered standing room in the center and we installed 2 queen size beds on each end. Very comfortable and took about 10 minutes to install. Has a FLashlight hanger and some other slots around the tent to hang wallet and other items. Great tent
customer_reviews.author: JJV

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Loved this tent, easy to set up and fold up took a little longer because it’s wide but overall it was perfect, used it for four nights in hot and cold windy weather and it was great!
customer_reviews.author: MARIA E FRANCO

customer_reviews.title: Great until the zipper broke
customer_reviews.text: The size and shape of this tent is great. My husband and I used it with two full size mattresses and we could have easily fit in a third one. The two days we camped it rained, and rained, and rained, and rained. We did not do any extra waterproofing on this and the only rain we got were a few drops along one seem. I was incredibly impressed by that! However, come Sunday when it was time to go the zipper broke as we were unloading everything from the tent. Why they put such a wimpy zipper on this tent baffles me. We sent it back and Amazon was fantastic about the return.
customer_reviews.author: B&D's Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good value but takes time to erect
customer_reviews.text: Overall good value. Fits my young family of 5. Erection takes some time and requires stakes to remain upright, so be prepared for a 15 minute pitch. For reference, my benchmark is a 15 year old EMS Tristar which takes 5 minutes and requires zero stakes.
customer_reviews.author: Roundle

customer_reviews.title: Mostly a good tent.  Kept us dry!
customer_reviews.text: The bag that the tent came in could stand to be a little more roomy. I don't work at a tent factory, and thus neither I nor my husband could repack it to spec to fit it in well. The side wall tore easily when pulled on. Make sure the kids open it up and then walk through and re-close it. The other minor issue was with the rain fly. One spot had un-matching velcro, so it wouldn't latch in that spot. We truly appreciated the videos that others posted about pitching this tent. Thanks bunches for saving us some of the learning curve. It did rain when we were camping, though lightly. No leaks!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great "Car-Camping"/Weekend Tent!
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tent for the money, first and foremost. If you are wanting a HIGH-quality tent (to go up in the mountains to do some REAL camping, or similar [ie; snow, heavy rain, etc]), this is not the tent for you. I would recommend getting an REI, or The North Face tent if you are wanting TOP quality. If you are wanting something to go "weekend-car-camping", this tent is perfect. It will not, however, hold up to extreme weather and will have minor leaks in even light rain. Just understand, while Coleman is a good and trusted brand, it is not meant for extreme camping/weather situations.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew C Garza

customer_reviews.title: I don't think it was any worse than any other tent I've ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Used this for our Boy Scout camp out. I was concerned about all the reviews saying that when they woke up things were soaked. While yes, the dew made the sides wet, I don't think it was any worse than any other tent I've ever owned. We're not talking puddles on the floor (yes it did rain). The space is HUGE and it was easy to set up. Great tent for the size/price.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle L Vasquez

customer_reviews.title: Wait and see if the price drops!
customer_reviews.text: Just spent all summer using this awesome tent! It is so spacious and unbelievably easy to set up. I was able to set this up by myself within 15ish minutes, Tearing down and getting it to fit back in the bag took some mental work, but got it done. The only reason I posted a 4 star was because within weeks of me purchasing this, it was a daily deal and was about $50 cheaper. :( So make sure you wait a bit before you buy, just to see if the price drops.
customer_reviews.author: magstar

customer_reviews.title: Tent poles all broken! BEWARE inspect contents before heading out camping!
customer_reviews.text: Tent poles that are used to put up tent were completely broken upon delivery. Did not inspect contents until the day we went camping. Fortunately I brought my old tent of the same style and was able to use the old tent poles to put up tent. The nylon cord on all the main tent poles were snapped or cut not really sure how that's possible with a brand new tent upon opening unless this was a return I received that somebody failed to inspect.
customer_reviews.author: Victor A. Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Great tent. Will easily fit 2 queen size mattresses ...
customer_reviews.text: Great tent. Will easily fit 2 queen size mattresses with a couple folding chairs, a few coolers and packs and small folding table... PLENTY of room to spare...would probably fit 3 queen mattresses without all that other stuff I listed we had in there.. This thing is huge. Just got back from camping in The Sangre de Cristo mountains where it rained pretty much every night. Definitely watertight. Very easy to set up. The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that there is basically no getting it back in the storage bag it ships in, so we just got a small duffel bag for it instead.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Rawls

customer_reviews.title: Roomy and weather proof
customer_reviews.text: I like how spacious this tent is. You can walk around inside and there is room to have an air mattress and also sleeping bags plus suitcases. It's fast to set up and tear down but I think next time we will go with an instant tent to make it even faster
customer_reviews.author: Erin McLaughlin

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Big and roomy. Rained all night the last night I was camping. I did seal the seams on the tent and I think that is just common sense. The wind blew hard several times and the tent stayed in tact. Only thing I could wish for is a tent that would allow me to stand straight up. I'm 6'5" and it seems all tents are not. The other issue is the small covered vent flap where I would anticipate one might bring in a power cord. I cut a small slit in the mesh as high as possible to bring in electricity.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: and has enjoyed it on family outings for a few years
customer_reviews.text: My brother has this same tent, and has enjoyed it on family outings for a few years. Based on my knowledge of Coleman, and what I like about this specific tent, I bought one. Unfortunately my experience was not the same. Three weeks after purchase, I went out on a 4 day camping trip, took the tent out of the box, and one of the anchor straps at the base tore almost off before I even got the guy stood up. Tent last the trip, but would've expected to get many more trips from it. Not sure that's going to happen now.
customer_reviews.author: Randy L Richey

customer_reviews.title: Tent in poor condition and has design flaws - do not buy
customer_reviews.text: Tent arrived with a lot of flaws. White upper portion or tent had a number of black spots and smaller and more numerous brownish-red spots. Lower black body of tent had 4-6 pin sized holes. This portion of the tent is not covered by the rainfly so tent will not be waterproof in any amount of rain. Tent also has some design flaws that I can see will make it difficult to keep tent in good shape and not accidentally tear the body of tent when inserting or removing poles for rain fly. I will return tent for flaws and not repurchase because of design flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Darren Petersen

customer_reviews.title: Its Huge!
customer_reviews.text: We used it for the first time last weekend and we loved how spacious it was. You can easily stand up straight in the middle of the tent. It will easily fit 2 queen size inflatable mattresses.
customer_reviews.author: Jose N.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful Tent!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this tent for our family camping trip. It set up easily as well as came down and folded up reasonably well. We had plenty of room for two adults, 4 teenagers, and 1 child with no crowding at all. (granted, none of us are hulking specimens of humanity, but I believe even a more stout family would have enough space.) We had two heavy thunderstorms two nights of our camping trip and this tent weathered them like a champ. We were snug as a bug in a rug the whole trip and not an ounce of water got into the tent. Extremely happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Sandy Dee

customer_reviews.title: Crappy zipper!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this tent for a few years now. I hate the zipper! It has always been an issue for us. It continues to catch and separate, as we pack up from camping tomorrow, I will be tossing this tent in the garbage! We only camp 2 times per year, so it's not as if it has been overly used in the past few years. I do like the size of this tent, but if we can't keep bugs out and securely close the tent up, then I see no point in the continued headache. Poor job Coleman!!
customer_reviews.author: Sundog

customer_reviews.title: Roomy Tent
customer_reviews.text: This is a good tent for larger families. It is roomy which allows more personal space while sleeping and is good for family time while the weather is less than desirable. My family stayed in this tent during a wintry mix and stayed dry.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela A. Drayer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tent.
customer_reviews.text: We love this tent. We are a family of 5 and it fit us all quite nicell. We have a queen and 3 twin air mattresses and they all fit. The ventilation in this tent is really good. So easy to put up and take down (remember to put all stakes in before putting poles in otherwise it isn't pulled tight enough on the bottom). Highly recommend this tent. Looks good too, nice subtle colours.
customer_reviews.author: ScotsLass

customer_reviews.title: great tent
customer_reviews.text: This tent is HUGE! We are a family of four, 2 kids are 3.5 years old. We wanted a tent that we could set up a queen air mattress, and also a double air bed with a divider up and still have room for other stuff. We had more than enough room. I'm 5'2", my husband 6', we could easily stand up in the middle of the tent. We had no moisture get into the tent, it was humid and we had some light rain one night. The ventilation on the tent is excellent. If you don't need the rain fly on, it would be an excellent tent to star gaze in. Very happy with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Nky

customer_reviews.title: Great tent for the cost
customer_reviews.text: We put the tent up once at home before camping to make sure we could and to make sure all parts were there. All the parts were there and it took about 20 minutes to put up. When we went camping the next week and put it up the second time it only took about 15 min. It came a long severe thunderstorm the second night we were camping. We did have a tarp hanging over the tent but the tent did get plenty wet with the sideways rain. It held up well. No leaks. No wet spots where the tent was touched. It is spacious and comfortable. Great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: and it's been a great and sturdy tent through six camping trips so far
customer_reviews.text: I've had this tent for a year and a half. I reinforced the seams with weatherproofing as soon as it came, and it's been a great and sturdy tent through six camping trips so far. That's about 18 nights in all kinds of weather, and I've had no problem. Great tent! Plus, it's so big, I can fit ALL of my other equipment inside when it rains, including my bike, all my outside furniture, big cooler, folding table...and still have plenty of room. Also, I'm just short of 6 feet tall, and I can stand straight up in the middle, no problem. I just love this great tent! I'll post a couple of pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Jana

customer_reviews.title: Pretty easy to setup and take down
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to setup and take down. I water proofed the seams and the rain fly and it kept us dry all week. Had some pretty heavy showers one day and a few scattered storm that week. Good amount of room. Will sleep four with gear and air mattresses comfortably. Ventilation is a little lacking with the rain fly on. Other than that great tent.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Peterson

customer_reviews.title: And lucky for us we got to experience going from super blazing hot
customer_reviews.text: Very roomy inside. I bought this for mine and my family's first time camping. And lucky for us we got to experience going from super blazing hot, to terrible flood like storm, and a chilly night. Tent survived the intense wind and rain only with some minor down side which was the lower part of the tent seam (the lower gray part) was not waterproof and we had leakage around the whole tent from the storm. No biggie we just moved everything we can away from the edge. Only a few things we weren't able to got soaked. But overall a good sturdy tent.
customer_reviews.author: Asianflwer

customer_reviews.title: Broken poles w/in 1hr
customer_reviews.text: Recently purchased this trip. Unpacked it in order to seal it and set it up. Both rainfly poles snapped within an hour of being set up, no no apparent reason other than low quality. Extremely disappointed in the quality of this product, it never made it out of the first hour in the back yard. Guaranteed to get you wet in the rain without the rainfly poles, because it essentially directs all the water into your side window/door. Save yourself the trouble and get a better tent.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This tent is not as described
customer_reviews.text: The tent that you get from amazon is not as described. There is no electrical access door. This does not come with the hammer or the expandable bag. We got it set up and realized that the little window on the bottom does not open like the description says. This is a big feature for us. I called amazon and they sent me a replacement. The replacement tent did not have the pass through door either. The positive is that while it was set up it did rain. The tent stayed bone dry. It was easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Sgraham

product_meta.title: Coleman 8-Person Tent for Camping | Red Canyon Car Camping Tent
product_meta.description:
AMAZON.COM
Measuring 17- by 10-feet, Coleman's Red Canyon tent is spacious enough to comfortably sleep eight campers. Ideal for weekend camping trips with family and friends, the Red Canyon features removable privacy walls, allowing you to create up to three separate rooms.
feature_bullets: Camping tent with spacious design offers enough room for 8 people to sleep comfortably
Included dividers let you create 3 separate rooms for privacy
WeatherTec system with patented welded floors and inverted seams keeps you dry
Measures 17 x 10 feet with 6-foot center height
Easy to set up and pack away with separate bags included for tent, poles, and stakes

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
